definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Write FAMILY at the top of your kitchen's dry-erase board.
sentences.chinese: 在你厨房黑板上写上家这字。

sentences.english: I have back-to-back tutoring sessions today.
sentences.chinese: 我今天要连着上家教课。

sentences.english: The cribs were sold at Toys "R" Us, Babies "R" Us and other stores.
sentences.chinese: 玩具反斗城，婴儿反斗城和其他上家均有销售。

sentences.english: A method where a process signals its predecessor that more material is needed.
sentences.chinese: 一个步骤会发出信号给上家说需要更多原料的方法。

sentences.english: Beaming villagers scramble up ladders to smarten up the fronts of their homes.
sentences.chinese: 灿烂的村民爬上家门前的梯子。

definition: variant of 老闆|老板[lao3 ban3]
player whose turn comes next (in a game)/next one/my humble home
derivative (math.)/business on WeChat 微信[Wei1 xin4] leveraging one's social network/person who operates such a business
a relative (i.e. family relation)/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to generate fake transactions in order to game a commercial online platform (one that rewards users who make numerous transactions)
second party (law)/see also 甲方[jia3 fang1]
